title: Texans Kick Off Midterm Elections With Primaries for Governor, Congress
sub_head: The contests will play an outsize role in deciding the general election because redistricting cut the number of competitive House seats
body:
AUSTIN, Texas—Voters in Texas head to the polls Tuesday in the first primary of the 2022 midterm elections that will decide many of the matchups for governor, the state’s 38 congressional districts and several statewide offices.
Republican Gov. Greg Abbott and former Democratic presidential candidate Beto O’Rourke are favored to win their respective party’s primary in the gubernatorial race. Other contests are being closely watched for what they say about the state of the Democratic and Republican parties as they vie for control of Congress.
